subject: Re: [junit] using try catch in testXXX()
msgSnippet: ... No, you can just have a throws-clause in the test method. Johannes -- +++ GMX - Mail, Messaging & more  http://www.gmx.net +++ NEU: Mit GMX ins Internet.
messageBody:
> However, if what you are saying is -- Why have try{}catch{} at all in the
> tests? -- this is, of course, necessary for checked exceptions in order
> to compile.

No, you can just have a throws-clause in the test method.

Johannes
